questions.question: What are the synthesis conditions for Zn1 and Zn2?
questions.answer: Zn1 was prepared by hydro-thermal method using Zn(CH3COO)2·2H2O and H2tbia in deionized water at 120°C for 2 days. Zn2 was synthesized by dissolving Zn(CH3COO)2·2H2O, H2tbia in DMF and H2O, followed by treatment in a Teflon-lined stainless steel at 120°C for 2 days, then alternately placed in 2-methylimidazole solution and Zn(NO3)2·6H2O solution for 10 cycles.

questions.question: What is the maximum adsorption capacity of Zn2@ZIF-8@SA for QNC?
questions.answer: The maximum adsorption capacity of Zn2@ZIF-8@SA for QNC is 142.1 mg·g−1.

questions.question: How does Zn2@ZIF-8@SA detect pesticides and what is its limit of detection for QNC?
questions.answer: Zn2@ZIF-8@SA detects pesticides through fluorescence quenching assays. The limit of detection (LOD) for QNC is 0.08 µM.

questions.question: Is the Zn2@ZIF-8@SA stable in water and organic solvents?
questions.answer: Yes, Zn2@ZIF-8@SA is stable in H2O for up to 30 days and in various organic solvents (DMF, CH3CN, EtOH) for up to 7 days.

questions.question: What is the role of the pseudo-second-order kinetic model in the adsorption behavior of Zn2@ZIF-8@SA?
questions.answer: The pseudo-second-order kinetic model better fits the adsorption data of Zn2@ZIF-8@SA, suggesting that chemisorption majorly controls the QNC pesticide adsorption rate.

questions.question: Can Zn2@ZIF-8@SA be reused for QNC removal, and if so, what is its efficiency after five cycles?
questions.answer: Yes, Zn2@ZIF-8@SA can be reused for QNC removal. Its removal efficiency decreases to 62.13% after five successive cycles.

questions.question: What is the mechanism behind the fluorescence quenching effect of Zn2@ZIF-8@SA towards pesticides?
questions.answer: The fluorescence quenching effect of Zn2@ZIF-8@SA towards pesticides is attributed to a combined effect of electron transfer and competition mechanism.

questions.question: Does the Zn2@ZIF-8@SA composite have anti-interference capabilities in the presence of common species?
questions.answer: True, Zn2@ZIF-8@SA has superior anti-interference capabilities in the presence of common species such as Na+, K+, Mg2+, etc.

questions.question: What are the practical applications of Zn2@ZIF-8@SA as demonstrated in the study?
questions.answer: Zn2@ZIF-8@SA is used for the sensitive detection of pesticides with low detection limits and for the removal of pesticides from environmental water and soil samples.

questions.question: How does the structure of Zn2@ZIF-8@SA contribute to its functionality in pesticide detection and removal?
questions.answer: The structure of Zn2@ZIF-8@SA, featuring abundant active sites and open metal sites, contributes to its functionality by enhancing stability, fluorescence property, and providing efficient pathways for pesticide detection and removal.
